intro: Bucholzia, commonly known as the African wild bean, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to Africa. The plants are characterized by their compound leaves and showy, pod-like fruits that contain edible seeds. Bucholzia species are often found in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. They play a role in local ecosystems and have been used traditionally for food and medicinal purposes.
